name: Studio Practice
description: A project-based studio course in which each student works to advance and to articulate their visual arts practice, and to develop individual process, themes and influences, the articulation. Group critiques, seminars, reading and writing assignments. Open media, students must have access to own means of production.
division: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
department: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
prerequisites: 1.0 FCE at the 200-level in VIS courses, JAV200H1/VIS200H1
